channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Corner of Hartland and Salusbury roads, 17th September
item.description:
Outside marsh and parsons. White graffiti on green box. Reporting again as this has not been addressed.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Salusbury Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin outside Starbucks, 17th September
item.description:
Bin is tagged and full of stickers. Pavement is badly stained from the Starbucks rubbish bags piled there daily.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Salusbury Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Salusbury and Hartland, 17th September
item.description:
Once again, street cleaners are not sweeping the side street on Hartland. There is broken glass and rubbish there now that hasn’t been swept in several days.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Salusbury Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous barbed wire, 17th September
item.description:
Rusty barbed wire and dilapidated fence beside the footpath in the park (Kings Meadow) and close to the children's playground. The wire is overhanging into the public area at a child's face height.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Burnt Ash Lane, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Disgusting litter blocking side walks, 17th September
item.description:
Again, litter dumped here by neighbours around the area which attract animals at night and block the side walks during the day.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Powerscroft Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree overgrown taking up too much pavement space, 17th September
item.description:
Trees in this area need to be checked. They are overgrown and taking up half the pavement for people to walk on. Given this is my second report of the same kind; I would suggest the area is checked.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 172, Bladindon Drive, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree taking up half the pavement, 17th September
item.description:
Tree in this area needs to be pruned. It is low and overgrown therefore taking up half of the pavement space available.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 102, The Drive, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dorchester Avenue Sign Dumped in Woods / Missing From Road, 17th September
item.description:
See above. Explains it clearly along with image. Sad this has happened but the sign needs to be put back where it belongs and removed from our green space. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Murchison Avenue, Albany Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excessive weeds on pavement, 17th September
item.description:
Case 8117623 was previously raised and updated by yourselves as ‘Fixed’ 2 weeks ago but no action has been taken to resolve the issue. The excessive weeds on the pavement are still causing issues and I have had further complaints from other passers by who knock at my door. I have told them to contact bexley council.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stapleton Road, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree branches need pruning, 17th September
item.description:
Branches too low infringing onto pavement, risk to public using pavement especially those with impaired vision and hitting cars parked underneath it The branches also now hitting houses. It needs pruning back for H&S reasons as seen in attached photos.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Prince George Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Private residents fly tip, 17th September
item.description:
The private residents at 29, St Margaret’s terrace think it is ok to fly tip outside their rented property with rubbish from their back garden and seem to think this is how they can get it moved by RBG for free

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blendon Terrace, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped flat pack furniture, 17th September
item.description:
Has been dumped here
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bramshaw Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Lots of black bags of rubbish on the side of the road, 17th September
item.description:
Multiple bags of rubbish left on the side of the road, foxes have got to it
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alwold Crescent, Horn Park, London

item.title: The top Of Derrick Rd BR3 towards Birchwood Ave, 17th September
item.description:
Broken branch obstructing the pavement / the tree also needs pruning the tree roots are pushing the pavement up making it quite difficult to walk on the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Derrick Road, Elmers End, London
